title: Yumi
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Yumi/zh-CN "Yumi/zh-CN")

| ) [![Yumi.png](/images/f/fb/Yumi.png)](/wiki/File:Yumi.png) |                                                         |
| ----------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                        | yumi                                                    |
| Appearance                                                  | long bow                                                |
| Damage vs. small                                            | 1d2                                                     |
| Damage vs. large                                            | 1d2                                                     |
| To-hit bonus                                                | +0                                                      |
| Weapon skill                                                | [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow")                                  |
| Size                                                        | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")             |
| Base price                                                  | 60 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                      | [30](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material                                                    | [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood")                               |

A **yumi** is a type of [launcher](/wiki/Launcher "Launcher") [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow") designed for use with [ya](/wiki/Ya "Ya"), and appears as a **long bow** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Origin](#Origin)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.2 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

The yumi is not randomly generated, although it may be found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") or [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai") start each game with a +0 yumi and a stack of ya to use as ammo.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

Samurai gain +1 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit"), [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") and [damage](/wiki/Damage "Damage") bonuses when firing ya from a yumi.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) For other roles, it is essentially the same as a normal bow.

## Strategy

The yumi provides a more-than-decent ranged option for Samurai in the early game.

## History

The yumi is introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"). In [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10") and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, Samurai start with a stack of [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken").[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Yumi](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yumi "wikipedia:Yumi")***

As used in English, *yumi* refers more specifically to traditional Japanese asymmetrical bows, which includes the longer *daikyū* and the shorter *hankyū* used in the practice of kyūdō and kyūjutsu, or Japanese archery.

The yumi was an important weapon of the samurai warrior during the feudal period of Japan, with *ya* as ammo, and their designed evolved from *maruki yumi* that date back to pre-3rd century CE: these were constructed with small saplings or tree limbs, and came in various sizes, with the majority of them being short with a centre grip. The first written record of the asymmetrical yumi appears in [the Book of Wei](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Book_of_Wei "wikipedia:Book of Wei"), a Chinese historical manuscript dating bacl to the 3rd century CE—the oldest one found to date was discovered in Nara Prefecture and estimated to be from the 5th century. The yumi underwent a change in length and construction method during the the Heian period (794–1185), then again to a two-piece bamboo-and-wood laminated yumi by the end of the 10th century—its construction evolved over the next several hundred years, and settled into its modern design by the 16th century.

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), the [Yoichi no Yumi](/index.php?title=Yoichi_no_Yumi\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Yoichi no Yumi (page does not exist)") is a [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") yumi that acts as the [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift for a hero that serves [Amaterasu Omikami](/wiki/Amaterasu_Omikami "Amaterasu Omikami"). It grants +1d20 to-hit and double damage to ya fired from it, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to create more ya similar to [the Longbow of Diana](/wiki/The_Longbow_of_Diana "The Longbow of Diana").

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds the Yoichi no Yumi from dNetHack, which can be randomly generated, gifted or created by [Duri](/wiki/Duri "Duri") at [The Forge](/wiki/The_Forge "The Forge").

## Encyclopedia entry

The samurai is highly trained with a special type of bow,  
the yumi. Like the ya, the yumi is made of bamboo. With  
the yumi-ya, the bow and arrow, the samurai is an extremely  
accurate and deadly warrior.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 298](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objects.c#L298)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 136](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L136)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 158](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/dothrow.c#L158)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1665](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/dothrow.c#L1665)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 846](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/uhitm.c#L846)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [u\_init.c in NetHack 3.0.0, line 200](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.0.0/u_init.c#line200 "Source:NetHack 3.0.0/u init.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Yumi

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
)
Name yumi
Appearance long bow
Damage vs. small 1d2
Damage vs. large 1d2
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill bow
Size one-handed
Base price 60 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 30
Material wood

A yumi is a type of launcher weapon that appears in NetHack. It is a bow designed for use with ya, and appears as a long bow when unidentified.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Origin
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 dNetHack
    • 6.2 SlashTHEM
  • 7 Encyclopedia entry
  • 8 References

Generation

The yumi is not randomly generated, although it may be found in bones or wished for.[1]

Samurai start each game with a +0 yumi and a stack of ya to use as ammo.[2]

Description

Samurai gain +1 to-hit, multishot and damage bonuses when firing ya from a yumi.[3][4][5] For other roles, it is essentially the same as a normal bow.

Strategy

The yumi provides a more-than-decent ranged option for Samurai in the early game.

History

The yumi is introduced in NetHack 3.1.0. In NetHack 3.0.10 and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, Samurai start with a stack of shuriken.[6]

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Yumi

As used in English, yumi refers more specifically to traditional Japanese asymmetrical bows, which includes the longer daikyū and the shorter hankyū used in the practice of kyūdō and kyūjutsu, or Japanese archery.

The yumi was an important weapon of the samurai warrior during the feudal period of Japan, with ya as ammo, and their designed evolved from maruki yumi that date back to pre-3rd century CE: these were constructed with small saplings or tree limbs, and came in various sizes, with the majority of them being short with a centre grip. The first written record of the asymmetrical yumi appears in the Book of Wei, a Chinese historical manuscript dating bacl to the 3rd century CE—the oldest one found to date was discovered in Nara Prefecture and estimated to be from the 5th century. The yumi underwent a change in length and construction method during the the Heian period (794–1185), then again to a two-piece bamboo-and-wood laminated yumi by the end of the 10th century—its construction evolved over the next several hundred years, and settled into its modern design by the 16th century.

Variants

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, the Yoichi no Yumi is a lawful artifact yumi that acts as the crowning gift for a hero that serves Amaterasu Omikami. It grants +1d20 to-hit and double damage to ya fired from it, and can be invoked to create more ya similar to the Longbow of Diana.

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM adds the Yoichi no Yumi from dNetHack, which can be randomly generated, gifted or created by Duri at The Forge.

Encyclopedia entry

The samurai is highly trained with a special type of bow,
the yumi. Like the ya, the yumi is made of bamboo. With
the yumi-ya, the bow and arrow, the samurai is an extremely
accurate and deadly warrior.

References

  1. ↑ src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 298
  2. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 136
  3. ↑ dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 158
  4. ↑ dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1665

  6. ↑ u_init.c in NetHack 3.0.0, line 200

A '''yumi''' is a type of [[launcher]] [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[bow]] designed for use with [[ya]], and appears as a '''long bow''' when [[identification|unidentified]].

==Generation==
The yumi is not randomly generated, although it may be found in [[bones]] or [[wish]]ed for.{{refsrc|src/objects.c|298|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

[[Samurai]] start each game with a +0 yumi and a stack of ya to use as ammo.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|136|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Description==
Samurai gain +1 [[to-hit]], [[multishot]] and [[damage]] bonuses when firing ya from a yumi.{{refsrc|dothrow.c|158|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|dothrow.c|1665|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|uhitm.c|846|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} For other roles, it is essentially the same as a normal bow.

==Strategy==
The yumi provides a more-than-decent ranged option for Samurai in the early game.

==History==
The yumi is introduced in [[NetHack 3.1.0]]. In [[NetHack 3.0.10]] and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, Samurai start with a stack of [[shuriken]].{{refsrc|nethack=3.0.0|u_init.c|200}}

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Yumi}}
As used in English, ''yumi'' refers more specifically to traditional Japanese asymmetrical bows, which includes the longer ''daikyū'' and the shorter ''hankyū'' used in the practice of kyūdō and kyūjutsu, or Japanese archery.

The yumi was an important weapon of the samurai warrior during the feudal period of Japan, with ''ya'' as ammo, and their designed evolved from ''maruki yumi'' that date back to pre-3rd century CE: these were constructed with small saplings or tree limbs, and came in various sizes, with the majority of them being short with a centre grip. The first written record of the asymmetrical yumi appears in [[wikipedia:Book of Wei|the Book of Wei]], a Chinese historical manuscript dating  bacl to the 3rd century CE—the oldest one found to date was discovered in Nara Prefecture and estimated to be from the 5th century. The yumi underwent a change in length and construction method during the the Heian period (794–1185), then again to a two-piece bamboo-and-wood laminated yumi by the end of the 10th century—its construction evolved over the next several hundred years, and settled into its modern design by the 16th century.

==Variants==
===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], the [[Yoichi no Yumi]] is a [[lawful]] [[artifact]] yumi that acts as the [[crowning]] gift for a hero that serves [[Amaterasu Omikami]]. It grants +1d20 to-hit and double damage to ya fired from it, and can be [[invoked]] to create more ya similar to [[the Longbow of Diana]].

===SlashTHEM===
[[SlashTHEM]] adds the Yoichi no Yumi from dNetHack, which can be randomly generated, gifted or created by [[Duri]] at [[The Forge]].

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
The samurai is highly trained with a special type of bow,
the yumi.  Like the ya, the yumi is made of bamboo.  With
the yumi-ya, the bow and arrow, the samurai is an extremely
accurate and deadly warrior.
}}
